intro: Willoughbya linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willoughbya, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with red stamens. It is often found in sandy soils in coastal regions and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions. Willoughbya linearifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
